main event: An orange object was tracked by radar for 4 1/2 minutes on 11 October 1956 in Temple City, California.
interesting points: The object was bright and flashing during the observation,The radar tracked the object for the entire duration,It was described as being large compared to a star,The object rose from the horizon to about 20Â° elevation in 5 minutes,It moved east at a slow speed after becoming motionless.
witness description: civilians, including Capt. Harry R. Sherrill and potentially others
